dt: {bc}to seize and hold (office, place, functions, powers, etc.) in possession by force or without right
{bc}to take or make use of without right

dt.t: {wi}usurped{/wi} the rights to her life story

dt: {bc}to take the place of by or as if by force {bc}{sx|supplant||}

dt.t: must not let stock responses based on inherited prejudice {wi}usurp{/wi} careful judgment

dt: {bc}to seize or exercise authority or possession wrongfully

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}usorper{/it}, from Latin {it}usurpare{/it} to take possession of without legal claim, from {it}usu{/it} (ablative of {it}usus{/it} use) + {it}rapere{/it} to seize {ma}{mat|rapid|}{/ma}
shortdef: to seize and hold (office, place, functions, powers, etc.) in possession by force or without right
to take or make use of without right
to take the place of by or as if by force : supplant
